DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate safety efficacy OptiMedica Femtosecond Laser System perform surgical maneuver use treatment subject cataracts . The safety efficacy compare standard surgical procedure continuous curvilinear capsulorhexis ( CCC ) ultrasonic phacoemulsification .
DOC.brief_title: Study Femtosecond Laser System Compared Continuous Curvilinear Capsulorhexis Cataract Surgery
DOC.criteria: Able willing comply treatment/followup schedule requirement Able understand provide write Informed Consent ETDRS ( Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study ) visual acuity equal worse 20/32 ( best correct ) Age 50 80 year old Pupil dilate least 7 mm Subject able fixate Grade 14 nuclear sclerotic cataract ( Lens Opacities Classification System LOCS III ) Axial length 22 26 mm Pregnant , intend become pregnant course study , less 3 month postpartum less 6 week completion breastfeed Participation study another device drug within 3 month prior study enrollment study , per Investigator 's careful discretion , long contradictory criterion Any condition , Investigator 's opinion , would make unsafe ( subject study personnel ) treat subject part research study cataract surgery contraindicate Anterior chamber depth ( anterior corneal surface anterior capsule margin ) less 2.5 mm via IOL Master ( Zeiss ) . History prior ocular surgery History ocular trauma Coexisting ocular disease affect vision History current use alpha1 antagonist medication ( e.g. , Flomax ) Known sensitivity plan concomitant medication
